answers.answer:
Yes, free medical care is available for people fleeing the war in Ukraine through various organizations such as IOM Romania, the Ukrainian clinic MedZirka, and the Red Cross, offering services like consultations and access to some medical care.

To find detailed information, please visit the website https://dopomoha.ro/en/free-medical-care and read under the sections for "Medical assistance offered by IOM Romania," "Free medical consultations from the Ukrainian clinic MedZirka," and "Free medical care at the Health Promotion Center from the Red Cross."

You can find detailed information on the website `https://dopomoha.ro/en/free-medical-care` under the section titled "Medical assistance offered by IOM Romania to refugees from Ukraine".

answers.answer:
Refugees from Ukraine have access to free medical care, including general medical assistance, and online or offline consultations with family doctors, therapists, or pediatricians. Additionally, free medical consultations and access to some medical services are available.

You can find more detailed information by visiting the website https://dopomoha.ro/en/free-medical-care and reading under the sections "Medical assistance offered by IOM Romania to refugees from Ukraine", "Free medical consultations from the Ukrainian clinic MedZirka", and "Free medical care at the Health Promotion Center from the Red Cross".
